qas.question: What does the term CBR mean?
Which early MPEG layer used CBR?
The early software was restricted to which kind of bitrate?
What did more sophisticated MP3 encoders use to target an average bit rate?
What did encoders base the encoding rate for each frame on?

context: Early MPEG <a1_0>Layer III<a1_0/> encoders used what is now called <a0_0>Constant Bit Rate<a0_0/> (CBR). The software was only able to use a <a2_0>uniform<a2_0/> bitrate on all frames in an MP3 file. Later more sophisticated MP3 encoders were able to use the <a3_0>bit reservoir<a3_0/> to target an average bit rate selecting the encoding rate for each frame based on <a4_0>the complexity of the sound<a4_0/> in that portion of the recording.
